source.60d0473b:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.8a58c5b6:
# We only want to observe the omicron variant only, total sequence only, so we do not consider other feature
omicron_df = covid_df[covid_df.variant == 'Omicron']
omicron_df = omicron_df[['location','date','num_sequences_total']]
omicron_df.head()
source.68601bd5:
# let see the time series of omicron cases
time_series_df = omicron_df.groupby(['date']).sum()
time_series_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,10))
sns.lineplot(data = time_series_df, x= time_series_df.date,y= time_series_df.num_sequences_total, ax=ax)
source.75d64bab:
# We can see that only one country has omicron cases in 2022. We should not consider this value. Therefore, we update our dataframe to exclude data in 2022
time_series_df = omicron_df[omicron_df.date.dt.year != 2022]
time_series_df = omicron_df.groupby(['date']).sum()
time_series_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,10))
sns.lineplot(data = time_series_df, x= time_series_df.date,y= time_series_df.num_sequences_total, ax=ax)
source.58231f54:
# Let us observe which top 10 countries has the highest omicron case in 2021. I choose 2021 because omicron cases started to spread in 2021.
omicron_2021_df = omicron_df[omicron_df.date.dt.year == 2021]
omicron_2021_df = omicron_2021_df.groupby(['location']).sum()
omicron_2021_df.sort_values(by='num_sequences_total', ascending=False, inplace=True)
omicron_2021_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
source.9c9ba388:
fig, ax2 = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,10))
sns.barplot(x="location", y="num_sequences_total", data=omicron_2021_df.head(10), ax=ax2)
source.a69296a2: Seems the number of omicron cases peaks at around 350,000 cases at the end of 2021 and drops significantly at the beginning of 2022. Let's check whether it is true of because of lack of data
source.7ec7d365: Seems USA and UK has significant omicron cases in Year 2021.
source.5aa6c3ce: # Hi, Please upvote if you enjoy my analysis. Thank you!!
source.b521279e: Seems that the omicron cases increases exponentially starting in July and peaked at December 2021. We hope the cases will go down in 2022.
